message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL 

The paper deals with the automatic acquisition of taxonomies or concept hierarchies from a text corpus, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) research. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are the most likely sub-categories. The use of Formal Concept Analysis (FCA) and clustering algorithms also suggests a connection to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the mention of data sparseness and the use of smoothing techniques indicate a possible connection to cs.DL (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
